blocks.content:
# Welcome to the Infrastructure Engineer Launchpad

This launchpad is designed to accelerate onboarding for infrastructure engineers by consolidating essential observability and optimisation resources into a single, intuitive starting point. It provides guided access to documentation, best practices, and tutorial videos that help engineers efficiently manage cloud provisioning, monitor resource usage, optimise costs, analyse logs, and maintain host-level performance.
The goal is to reduce troubleshooting time, ensure consistent monitoring standards, and empower engineers to confidently manage hybrid and cloud-native environments.

Get automatic and intelligent observability across cloud and hybrid environments with continuous auto-discovery of any type of infrastructureâ€”all in context and with precise, AI-powered answers. 

* Read more about Infrastructure solutions in our [Documentation](https://docs.dynatrace.com/docs/platform-modules/infrastructure-monitoring) 
* Looking for something else? visit [Playground home](/ui/apps/dynatrace.launcher/launchpad/99583c94-6c7c-4a5d-9c23-1432e4e1746c) for a complete overview of Dynatrace modules and use-cases.

blocks.content:
# Dynatrace Infrastructure Monitoring Documentation

Explore official Dynatrace documentation to access detailed guidance on infrastructure monitoring, including host metrics, process analysis, container visibility, cloud integrations, and best practices for maintaining a secure and scalable observability platform.

---

## Key Topics

- [**Host Monitoring**](https://docs.dynatrace.comucture-monitoring/host-monitoring)  
  * Monitor CPU, memory, disk, and network performance for physical and virtual hosts to ensure system health and stability.

- [**Process Group Monitoring**](https://docs.dynatrace.com/docs/observe/infrastructure-monitoring/process-monitoring)  
  * Track critical processes, resource consumption, and dependencies for faster troubleshooting and performance optimisation.

- [**Container Monitoring**](https://docs.dynatrace.com/docs/observe/infrastructure-monitoring/container-monitoring)  
  * Gain deep visibility into containerised workloads, including Docker and Kubernetes, for cloud-native observability.

- [**Cloud Platform Monitoring**](https://docs.dynucture-monitoring/cloud-platform-monitoring)  
  * Integrate AWS, Azure, and GCP for real-time cloud resource observability and cost optimisation insights.

- [**Network Monitoring**](https://docs.dynatrace.com/docs/observe/infrastructure-monitoring/network-monitoring)  
  * Analyse network traffic, connectivity, and latency across your infrastructure to detect bottlenecks and improve reliability.

- [**Log Monitoring**](https://docs.dynatrace.com/docs/observe/infrastructure-monitoring/log-monitoring)  
  * Log Monitoring for real-time analysis and alerting to accelerate root cause detection and incident response.

- [**Custom Device Monitoring**](https://docs.dynatrace.com/docs/observeom-device-monitoring)  
  * Extend monitoring to non-standard devices and integrate external systems for complete observability coverage.

---

## ðŸŽ¯ Why Use Dynatrace Infrastructure Monitoring?
- **Unified Observability:** One platform for hosts, containers, networks, and logs.
- **AI-Powered Insights:** DavisÂ® AI for anomaly detection and root cause analysis.
- **Cloud-Native Ready:** Seamless integration with Kubernetes and major cloud providers.

blocks.content:
## Frequently Asked Questions (FAQ)

Explore common questions and answers to help you understand and implement Dynatrace Infrastructure Monitoring effectively.

---

### 1. What is Infrastructure Monitoring in Dynatrace?
Infrastructure Monitoring provides visibility into hosts, processes, containers, and networks across hybrid and cloud environments. It helps detect anomalies, optimise resource usage, and maintain system health.  
[Learn more](https://docs.dynatrace.com/docs/observe/infrastructure-monitoring)

---

### 2. How is Infrastructure Monitoring different from Full-Stack Monitoring?
Full-Stack Monitoring includes application-level tracing and code-level visibility, while Infrastructure Monitoring focuses on host and network metrics. For critical apps, Dynatrace recommends Full-Stack Monitoring; for Tier 2/3 systems, Infrastructure Monitoring mode is sufficient.  
[Details on monitoring modes](https://docs.dynatrace.com/docs/observe/infrastructure-monitoring/hosts/monitoring-modes)

---

### 3. What are the prerequisites for Infrastructure Monitoring?
- Deploy **Dynatrace OneAgent** on hosts for granular metrics.
- Integrate cloud platforms (AWS, Azure, GCP) for resource-level visibility.
- Configure permissions for logs, metrics, and events in Grail.  
[Setup guide](https://docs.dynatrace.com/docs/observe/infrastructure-monitoring/infrastructure-and-operations)

---

### 4. Can Dynatrace monitor containers and Kubernetes clusters?
Yes. Dynatrace offers **Kubernetes Platform Monitoring** for cluster health and resource optimisation, and **Code Monitoring** for application-level insights inside containers.  
[Container monitoring overview](https://docs.dynatrace.com/docs/license/capabilities/container-monitoring)

---

### 5. How do I set up Infrastructure Monitoring?
- Install Dynatrace OneAgent on your hosts or container platform.
- Configure monitoring settings for hosts, processes, and services.
- Create dashboards and alerts for proactive monitoring.  
[Step-by-step tutorial](https://docs.dynatrace.com/docs/observe/infrastructure-monitoring)

---

### 6. What metrics are available for hosts and containers?
- **Hosts:** CPU, memory, disk I/O, network traffic.
- **Containers:** CPU usage, memory consumption, disk operations, network throughput.  
[Host monitoring details](https://docs.dynatrace.com/docs/observe/infrastructure-monitoring/hosts)  
[Container monitoring details](https://docs.dynatrace.com/docs/license/capabilities/container-monitoring)

---

### 7. How effective is Infrastructure Monitoring on its own?
Infrastructure monitoring alone provides visibility into system health but lacks application context. For complete observability, combine it with service-level and user experience monitoring.  
[Read more](https://docs.dynatrace.com/docs/observe/infrastructure-monitoring/hosts/monitoring-modes/how-effective-is-infrastructure-monitoring-on-its-own)

---

### 8. Can Dynatrace monitor on-premises network devices?
Yes. Dynatrace supports SNMP-based monitoring for network devices using the Extension Framework, enabling visibility into routers, switches, and other physical components.  
[Network monitoring guide](https://docs.dynatrace.com/docs/observe/infrastructure-monitoring/networks/manage-on-prem-network-infrastructure)

---

### 9. What are common issues when setting up Infrastructure Monitoring?
- OneAgent deployment failures due to firewall restrictions.
- Missing traces from misconfigured instrumentation.
- Slow dashboards caused by excessive widgets or large data ranges.
- Incorrect alert thresholds leading to alert noise.  
[Troubleshooting guide](https://docs.dynatrace.com/docs/observe/infrastructure-monitoring)

---
